    • Method Detail

      • cropAndResize

        public SDVariable cropAndResize(String name,
                                SDVariable image,
                                SDVariable cropBoxes,
                                SDVariable boxIndices,
                                SDVariable cropOutSize,
                                CropAndResize.Method method,
                                double extrapolationValue)
        Given an input image and some crop boxes, extract out the image subsets and resize them to the specified size.
        Parameters:
        name - May be null. Name for the output variable.
        image - Input image, with shape [batch, height, width, channels]
        cropBoxes - Float32 crop, shape [numBoxes, 4] with values in range 0 to 1
        boxIndices - Indices: which image (index to dimension 0) the cropBoxes belong to. Rank 1, shape [numBoxes]
        cropOutSize - Output size for the images - int32, rank 1 with values [outHeight, outWidth]
        method - Image resize method
        extrapolationValue - Used for extrapolation, when applicable. 0.0 should be used for the default
        Returns:
        Cropped and resized images

      • extractImagePatches

        public SDVariable extractImagePatches(String name,
                                      SDVariable image,
                                      @NonNull
                                      int[] kSizes,
                                      @NonNull
                                      int[] strides,
                                      @NonNull
                                      int[] rates,
                                      boolean sameMode)
        Given an input image, extract out image patches (of size kSizes - h x w) and place them in the depth dimension.
        Parameters:
        name - Map be null. Name for the output variable
        image - Input image to extract image patches from - shape [batch, height, width, channels]
        kSizes - Kernel size - size of the image patches, [height, width]
        strides - Stride in the input dimension for extracting image patches, [stride_height, stride_width]
        rates - Usually [1,1]. Equivalent to dilation rate in dilated convolutions - how far apart the output pixels in the patches should be, in the input. A dilation of [a,b] means every ath pixel is taken along the height/rows dimension, and every bth pixel is take along the width/columns dimension
        sameMode - Padding algorithm. If true: use Same padding
        Returns:
        The extracted image patches

      • nonMaxSuppression

        public SDVariable nonMaxSuppression(String name,
                                    @NonNull
                                    SDVariable boxes,
                                    @NonNull
                                    SDVariable scores,
                                    @NonNull
                                    SDVariable maxOutSize,
                                    @NonNull
                                    SDVariable iouThreshold,
                                    @NonNull
                                    SDVariable scoreThreshold)
        Greedily selects a subset of bounding boxes in descending order of score
        Parameters:
        name - Might be null. Name for the output variable
        boxes - 2D array of shape [num_boxes,4]
        scores - vector of shape [num_boxes]
        maxOutSize - scalar representing the maximum number of boxes to be selected
        iouThreshold - float - threshold for deciding whether boxes overlap too much with respect to IOU
        scoreThreshold - float - threshold for deciding when to remove boxes based on score
        Returns:
        vectort of shape [M] representing the selected indices from the boxes tensor, where M <= max_output_size

      • adjustContrast

        public SDVariable adjustContrast(String name,
                                 @NonNull
                                 SDVariable in,
                                 @NonNull
                                 SDVariable factor)
        Adjusts contrast of RGB or grayscale images.
        Parameters:
        name - name for the output variable
        in - images to adjust. 3D shape or higher.
        factor - float multiplier for adjusting contrast.
        Returns:
        Contrast-adjusted image

        Adjust saturation of RGB images
        Parameters:

        Returns:
